content: simple knit shrug pattern made by marni revised june 11 2015 please note the beauty of this pattern is that it can be knit to fit your shape by increasing as long as you want the sleeve to be and working the back as long as you need it to be just be sure to mark the beginning and end of the back piece and keep track of the number of row you knit for each sleeve skills required gauge take time to check your gauge stockinette stitch purl odd row knit even row 8 stitches = 4 10 cm increase & decrease 12 row = 4 10 cm optional single_crochet border approximte measurements - size s m l yarn sleeve to sleeve length 54 57 60 4-6 skeins of lion brand vanna s choice worsted widest part back 18 19 20 weight yarn knit with double strands throughout abbreviations needles k knit p purl st s stitch es single_crochet single_crochet us 13 9mm circular knitting needles k2tog knit next 2 sts together 1 st decreased size j crochet hook optional border ssk slip 2 sts knitwise then knit them together 1 st decreased sleeve 1 piece of contrasting color yarn on each end of this row to mark the beginning of the second sleeve cast on 20 22 24 sts row 1 ws purl sleeve 2 row 2 knit row 3 purl row 1 ws purl row 4 knit row 2 knit row 5 purl row 3 purl row 6 increase row knit in the front and back of the row 4 knit first and last stitch of this row = 22 24 26 sts row 5 purl repeat these 6 row 8 9 10 more times or until row 6 decrease row k2tog knit to last 2 stitches you get the desired length sleeve you want ssk continue in stockinette stitch for 6 more row end repeat this 8 9 10 more times on knit row continue in stockinette stitch for 5 more row end attach a safety pin or other marker or tie a piece of on purl row cast off contrasting color yarn on each end of this row to mark finishing back beginning pin to measurements and block sew sleeve seams back from place markers to the ends weave in any ends ws continue in stockinette stitch for 54 57 60 optional border row or as many as needed to cover your with j crochet hook and double strands of yarn pick back attach a safety pin or other marker or tie a up and single_crochet all of the back piece stitches approx 100 106 112 single_crochet around once more and bind off weave in ends © 2015 marni reecer this pattern is for personal and non-profit use only for questions and support please email info@marnimadeit com simple knit shrug pattern made by marni revised june 11 2015 please note the beauty of this pattern is that it can be knit to fit your shape
